article.headline: Chattanooga 64, Wofford 55
article.story: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Casey Long scored 13 points, including eight free throws in the final minute, to lead Chattanooga to a 64-55 victory over Wofford on Wednesday in the first round of the Southern Conference Tournament. Long's shooting stymied a comeback by the Terriers, who trailed by as many as 16 in the second half but tied the game on a 19-4 run midway through the period. But Wofford, which trailed the entire game, could never gain the lead. The Terriers were down by four with a minute left but Long hit all eight of his free throws in the final minute to seal the victory. Marcus Watts added 11 for Chattanooga while Nicchaeus Doaks had 10. Junior Salters led Wofford with 17 while Shane Nichols added 15. Chattanooga shot 50 percent from the field while holding the Terriers to only 32 percent. The eighth-seeded Mocs (15-17) advance to play No. 1 seed Davidson in Thursday's quarterfinals. Chattanooga has made it to the championship game in each of the last four Southern Conference tournaments. Wofford, which came back from 11 behind to defeat the Mocs in the first meeting between the teams in January, finished its season at 10-20.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
